page.title: 19LANDSCAPE NEWBY VILLAGE
page.content: Newby lies to the North-East of Clapham,grid no.72-70:.There are forty houses in the village.There is one farm now but there used to be three. The village has one bridge it is very little but cars can cross it it has a very small stream passing beneath.There are no shops in the hamlet.Newby has a chapel and also a sunday school.It has a school which is now closed.There is a new house being built by Newby Hall Farm.This farm and Town Head were farmed by the monks of Furness Abbey. There was an inn called the Shepherds Rest now a house named Heather View.The main road lies about a quarter of a mile to the South -West.At the road junction there is a bus -stop by The Little Chef Cafe.Here the children are picked up to be taken to their respective schools on the A65
